result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Christopher E. WATKINS

records.descr: Motion and order for withdrawal of counsel

records.addlTxt:
Court questions defendant on the orders submitted to have Attorney Schreurs withdraw as counsel on both files.  Defendant is in agreement with Attorney Schreurs withdrawing and Attorney Kolell being substituted as counsel on both files.  Court signs both orders.
WAIVER OF PRELIMINARY HEARING
Defendant waives his right to a preliminary hearing. 
Defendant is bound over to Circuit Court Branch 2 for further proceedings.   Waiver of Right to Preliminary Hearing.
MOTION TO MODIFY BAIL
Attorney Kolell motions to amend the defendant's bail to drop the no contact wtih Sheila Kaderabek.  State has no objection to the modification.  Court grants motion.   Amended Cash Bail Bond.
ARRAIGNMENT
Information filed.  Not guilty pleas.  Jury Calendar.  Settlement conference with DA set for 10-16-15 at 3:00 p.m.   State's Motion and Demand for Discovery.
Minutes.
Attorney Matthew Kolell, through Public Defender.
Preliminary hearing reset for 09-02-15 at 1:30 p.m.

Defense counsel moves to withdraw per the defendant's request.  Motion granted.   Defendant waives the statutory time period within which a preliminary hearing must be held.   Preliminary hearing is reset to 09-02-15 at 1:30 p.m.   
Notice.
Minutes.
Travis Schreurs, through Public Defender

Defendant demands a preliminary hearing.  Preliminary hearing is set for 08-19-15 at 1:30 p.m.   
Minutes.
RE:  Bail jumping, on 07-25-15.

At 3:18 p.m., $200.00 cash bail furnished and defendant released from custody.
Notice to Party Furnishing Cash Bail.

Defendant in custody.  The State informs the Court that the defendant will be charged with the crimes of bail jumping and obstruct officer.  The matters are continued for initial appearance on 08-03-15 at 2:30 p.m. Bail is set at $200.00 cash  with the conditions that he report to the Manitowoc City Police Department for fingerprints, photographs and other identifying information within 24 hours of release and have no contact with Sheila Kaderabek.   Bail not  furnished and defendant is remanded into custody.  Commitment for failure to furnish bail issued.  Copy filed.
Minutes.
